summary: This bill, the Instructing Noteworthy Steps toward Transparency to Rout and Undo Calamitous Transactions Act of 2025 (INSTRUCT Act of 2025), amends the Higher Education Act of 1965. It mandates that disclosure reports of foreign gifts and contracts to educational institutions become public records. It also requires the Secretary of Education to share these reports with various federal agencies like the FBI, CIA, and Department of State. Furthermore, it mandates a Government Accountability Office (GAO) study to improve interagency coordination regarding the enforcement of the Higher Education Act and requires a report to Congress within three years.
